concept.title: Case 10: Evening discount for premium subscribers

section.title: Overview
section.p: Bob has an iPhone subscribed to a monthly data service. When Bob starts using data during the day, for example at around 9 am, then the charging is done at usual call rates. However, when Bob starts using data in the evening, for example around 7 pm, then special call rates are applied for charging the data call because Bob is recognized as a premium subscriber by the service operator.
The service operator offers special call rates to all its premium subscribers for all data calls executed during evening between specific hours.

Bob has a friend, Fred, not subscribed as a premium subscriber. The charges applied to all data calls executed by Fred from his Blackberry during the day or evening are the usual call rates and no special rates can be offered to Fred for evening data calls as he is a non-premium subscriber.

ul.li: The service operator creates a Gold and Non-Gold category for its subscribers. The Gold category subscribers are offered special reduced rates for data calls in evening.

Bob has an iPhone and is subscribed as a Gold subscriber for data services.
When Bob starts using data from his iPhone in the day, for example 9 am, then usual rate is applied for charging the data call during the day time.
When Bob starts using data from his iPhone in the evening, for example 7 pm, then special reduced rate is offered for charging the evening data call by the service operator.

Fred has a Blackberry and is subscribed as a Non-Gold subscriber for data services. When Fred starts using data from his Blackberry during the evening, then no special reduced rate is offered for charging the evening data call. All data calls executed by the Blackberry during the day or evening are charged at usual call rates.

section.title: Provisioning

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.

section.p:
Following entities are required for this use case. Entities for case 10
Entity Task
Rate Create two rates - discount and default.
Custom Data Create a custom data.
Charging Service Create a charging service.
Bundle Create a bundle and associate it with subscription lifecycle.
Rules and Variables Define the tariff rule for time of day.
Lifecycles Create a subscription, account, and device lifecycles.
Account Create an account and associate it with account lifecycle.
Device Create two devices - iPhone and Blackberry and associate them with device lifecycle.

li.p: Provision the discount rate and default rate. To do this, log in to the SM GUI and navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select the Charging tab. Browse to select the Rates from the drop-down list.
Rate_Gold is defined as 0.50 United States dollars for 200 MB of data consumed.
Rate_Default is defined as 1 United States dollars for 200 MB of data consumed.
